name: Lep Cookies
author: Helen Raines

ingredients.name: Tbsp. each nutmeg, cinnamon and cloves

instructions: Mix in following manner: Take molasses and lard and put in large pan on stove and let it get warm. Mix and let cool stirring constantly. Mix sugar and eggs. Take soda and mix in 1⁄2 cup of boiling water and add to previous mixture. Take raisins and nuts and dredge with 1 cup of flour. Mix them in and last add spices, flour and salt. Add enough flour to make soft dough. Roll out on lightly floured board and cut with doughnut cutter. Bake at 300° until light brown. Baking time is about 15 minutes. Recipe makes 5 gallon can full. It takes about 8 pounds of flour to make these cookies. They will be hard when first baked, will keep up to a year and soften as they age. Keep in covered container in which a tea towel has been laid into the bottom and then wrap it around cookies before putting on the lid. This recipe is over 100 years old. It is the recipe of Marylan Diebold's Great Grandmother.
